EXTRACTED VALUE: Turok is a solid enough shooter that won't wow you the way triple-A titles like "Call of Duty 4" or "Bioshock" will. [Mar 2008, p.85]
2006 FIFA World Cup manages to capture all of that magic and recreate the pageantry of the World Cup better than any World Cup game before it.
Simple on the surface, yet with almost endless replay value, and most definitely worthy of the great name it has inherited. [Issue#25, p.80]
Penny Arcade Adventures: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness is a great intro into the episodic gaming world.
The Video Editor will keep you busy for hours and the mixture of old and new gameplay components are more than enough to keep it from losing speed.
You get the feeling that the programmers enjoyed making it, enjoy gaming themselves, and just “get” what makes a game good.
Enchanted Arms is a completely standard RPG with some charming gameplay and plot elements that make it slightly better than average.
A strong fighting game, with combat mechanics that are both simple and deep.
